member.name: T:Rebex.Mime.Util.LineReceiver
member.summary: LineReceiver is an abstract write-only stream that breaks all incoming data into lines of a given maximum length delimited by CRLF sequences. When a complete line is processed, the virtual method is called and the line is passed as a parameter. Classes that need this functionality should inherit from and override the method.

member.name: M:Rebex.Mime.Util.LineReceiver.ProcessLine(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: A method that is called for each received line.
member.param: A buffer that contains the received line.
An offset indicating the start of the received line in the buffer.
Number of bytes in line, starting at offset.
True if a complete CRLF-terminated line was received; false if no CRLF was found.

member.name: M:Rebex.Mime.Util.LineReceiver.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of LineReceiver class.
member.param: Maximum line length, allowed range is 74 to 256K.

member.name: M:Rebex.Mime.Util.LineReceiver.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of LineReceiver class with a maximum line length of 65536.

member.summary: Distinguishes the token characters, as defined by RFC 2047.

member.returns: true if c is ASCII code of a printable character which is neither whitespace nor any of the "especials" defined by RFC 2047, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rebex.Mime.Util.HeaderUtil.QuotedPrintableEncode(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encodes 8-bit text into quoted-printable 7-bit text.
member.param: Buffer containing the 8-bit text to encode. This parameter must not be null.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin reading.
The number of bytes to read from buffer. This parameter must be positive.
member.returns: The encoded text. Implementations of this method must not return null (if they don't know what to return, they can throw).

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailMessage.IsSigned
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the message is signed.
member.value: A value indicating whether the message is signed.

remarks.p: Signers of a signed message are accessible through collection. The signature can be validated using method or removed using method. It is created using method.
Please note that messages that are encrypted might also be signed, but because the signature itself is also encrypted as well, this fact will not be known until the message is decrypted.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailMessage.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the message is encrypted.
member.value: A value indicating whether the message is encrypted.

remarks.p: Recipients of an encrypted message are accessible through collection. The message can be decrypted using method. To encrypt a message, use method.
Until an encrypted message is decrypted, its content is inaccessible.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailMessage.From
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of authors of this message.

remarks.p: This property specifies the the list of authors of the message.
If this field contains multiple authors, the '' field must be set to specify the agent responsible for the transmission of the message
If this field contains a single author that is also the sender of the message, the '' field should not be set.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailMessage.Sender
member.summary: Gets or sets the sender of this message.

remarks.p: This property specifies the agent responsible for the transmission of the message. Use to specify the list of authors of the message.
This field must be set if the '' field contains multiple authors.
This field should not be set if the ' field contains a single author that is also the sender of the message.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mail.MailMessage.EnvelopeId
member.summary: Gets or sets the envelope identifier to be transmitted along with the message and included in any DSNs issued.

remarks.p: The purpose of the envelope identifier is to allow the sender of a message to identify the transaction for which the DSN was issued.
Please note that the envelope ID is not a part of a mail message and is not saved with it. Its purpose is to be used while sending the message.
Envelope ID must be an ASCII string up to 100 characters in length. Characters <33 and character '+', '=' and character 127 are represented as three characters.

remarks.p: The purpose of enveloped content is to be encrypted. Call the method prior to saving or sending the message.

Default value is "This is a multipart MIME message."
The preamble is only used for multipart entities.

remarks.p: Epilogue is only used for multipart entities.

Default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage.EnvelopeId
member.summary: Gets or sets the envelope identifier to be transmitted along with the message and included in any DSNs issued.

remarks.p: The purpose of the envelope identifier is to allow the sender of a message to identify the transaction for which the DSN was issued.
Please note that the envelope ID is not a part of a mail message and is not saved with it. Its purpose is to be used while sending the message.
Envelope ID must be an ASCII string up to 100 characters in length. Characters <33 and character '+', '=' and character 127 are represented as three characters.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the origination date of this message.
member.remarks: The origination date specifies the date and time at which the creator of the message indicated that the message was complete and ready to enter the mail delivery system.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage.From
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of authors of this message.

remarks.p: This property specifies the the list of authors of the message.
If this field contains multiple authors, the '' field must be set to specify the agent responsible for the transmission of the message
If this field contains a single author that is also the sender of the message, the '' field should not be set.

member.name: P:Rebex.Mime.MimeMessage.Sender
member.summary: Gets or sets the sender of this message.

remarks.p: This property specifies the agent responsible for the transmission of the message. Use to specify the list of authors of the message.
This field must be set if the '' field contains multiple authors.
This field should not be set if the ' field contains a single author that is also the sender of the message.

member.name: T:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions
member.summary: Specifies various options for MIME parser and writer.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotWriteBcc
member.summary: Do not write the "Bcc" header into output stream.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotParseMimeTree
member.summary: Ignore the MIME tree and parse the message as a single-level entity.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.ProcessAllHeaders
member.summary: Parses and reencodes all headers, even when not needed or modified.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.IgnoreUnparsableHeaders
member.summary: Ignore unparsable headers when parsing mail message.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.AlwaysWriteContentTransferEncoding
member.summary: Always write a content-transfer-encoding, even if ir has a default value of "7bit"

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.IgnoreUnparsableSignatures
member.summary: Ignore unparsable S/MIME signature entities when parsing mail message.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.AllowAnyTextCharacters
member.summary: Skips checking of text content for text/* entities. When this options is enabled, it is possible to use any characters inside text entities and if quoted-printable transfer-encoding is specified, the encoder persists the original text structure.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotQuoteProblematicSequences
member.summary: Disables encoding of leading 'F', '.' and '-' character in body parts using quoted-printable content transfer encoding. These leading characters used to cause problems to legacy mail trasfer agents, so quoted-printable-encoding them was used as a workaround thata doesn't cause any problems to properly-implemented mail agents.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.OnlyParseHeaders
member.summary: Only parses message headers and ignores the body.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotAddDateIfNoSubjectAndFrom
member.summary: Do not automatically add a date header if 'date', 'subject' or 'from' headers are missing from a top-level or embedded message.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DisableEncryptionKeyPreference
member.summary: Do not include encryption key preference attribute in signed message attributes.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DisableSMimeCapabilitiesAttribute
member.summary: Do not include S/MIME options attribute in signed message attributes.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.SkipCertificateUsageCheck
member.summary: Skip certificate usage check.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.IgnoreInvalidTnefMessages
member.summary: Ignore invalid TNEF messages when parsing mail messages.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.SkipSenderCheck
member.summary: Skip sender check.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.KeepRawEntityBody
member.summary: Keep the raw entity body when parsing MIME messages and make it accessible using .

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotCloseStreamAfterLoad
member.summary: Keep the input stream open when method is done.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DoNotPreloadAttachments
member.summary: Try to conserve memory by not preloading attachment content when constructing a message.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.MimeOptions.DisableSinglePartHtmlWorkaround
member.summary: Disable a workaround for broken mail clients such as Mac mail that don't correctly parse HTML-only messages. By default, MailMessage class constructs a single-part multipart/alternative structure to solve this. Enabling this flag turns off this behavior.

member.name: T:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding
member.summary: Type of transfer encoding of the content.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown content encoding.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Quoted-Printable encoding.
member.remarks: The Quoted-Printable encoding is intended to represent data that largely consists of octets that correspond to printable characters in the US-ASCII character set.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.Base64
member.summary: Base64 encoding.
member.remarks: The Base64 encoding is designed to represent arbitrary sequences of octets in a form that is not humanly readable.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.SevenBit
member.summary: No encoding, content data is 7bit.

remarks.p: 7bit data refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences. No octets with decimal values greater than 127 are allowed and neither are NULs (octets with decimal value 0). CR (decimal value 13) and LF (decimal value 10) octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.EightBit
member.summary: No encoding, content data is 8bit.
member.remarks: 8bit data refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences. Octets with decimal values greater than 127 may be used. CR (decimal value 13) and LF (decimal value 10) octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences.

member.name: F:Rebex.Mime.TransferEncoding.Binary
member.summary: No encoding, content data is binary.
member.remarks: Binary data refers to data where any sequence of octets is allowed.
